result.execSummary:
The defendant Rudie M Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Costs to be paid within 90 days or penalty of civil judgment for non-payment.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Julian Marrufo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant Rudie M Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse.   

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Counts 1, 3 & 4 are dismissed as read ins.

FELONY WARNINGS PROVIDED:  REGARDING VOTING AND FIREARMS RESTRICTIONS.


Court orders the following:
150 Days Jail - Straight-Time.
105 Days Credit.

Attorney Ronald Sonderhouse

Shawn Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Rudie M Anderson in court, in custody.

Defendant presented bail arguments to the court.
State objects to any bail modification - Arguments presented.

Court Denies - Defendant's request for bail modification at this time.
Reasons placed on the record.
Court is willing to readdress bail once counsel is retained or appointed by SPD.

Defendant states that he is trying to obtain counsel on this case and on his Milwaukee County cases, but is now requesting another public defender to be appointed. 

Clerk makes phone call to public defender's office to make inquiry about getting the Defendant evaluated. Public Defender's office states that he will be added to the list for evaluations for today. Defendant will be evaluated before next hearing date. 

Defendant requests bail motion. Set for 05/23/2022 at 2:00 pm.

Defendant wants counsel to withdraw so he can retain private counsel. 

Court conducts colloquy re: withdrawal of counsel and withdrawal of speedy trial. 
COURT WILL ACCEPT THE DEFENDANT'S WITHDRAWAL OF SPEEDY TRIAL AND ALLOW ATTY HERBERS TO WITHDRAW.

09:15 AM Defendant Rudie M Anderson in court, in custody, with attorney J Andrew Herbers.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Waukesha County corrections officer Barbara Zinta sworn and testified on direct by Atty. Sitzberger.  Cross examination by Atty. Herbers.  State rests.  Testimony closed.  Atty. Sitzberger moves for bind over.  Atty. Herbers moves to dismiss.  Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Discovery received.  Hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
